image.altText: Tammy Franks in front of microphones with her arms out

props.synopsis: The now-former South Australian's Greens co-leader Tammy Franks quit the party this week and didn't go quietly. But what happens now for the party?

title.children: 'It's not easy being green': Kermit's famous line resonates for Greens

image.altText: A woman with black hair stands by the Murray River holding a diary that was returned to her

props.synopsis: A diary dating back to pre-World War I that was left on the doorstep of an RSL club in Adelaide has been united with the descendants of its writer.

title.children: Mysterious 121yo diary returned to its roots

image.altText: A sheep farmer in a paddock with his 2 school aged children and sheep behind them

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers say putting red meat on the dinner plate is one way for consumers to support them through the drought.

title.children: Farmers call on 'city cousins' to buy red meat amid SA drought

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain will drench Australia's east coast next week, but there will be no relief for drought-ravaged South Australia, Victoria and south-west New South Wales.

title.children: First taste of winter with upcoming temperature drop after warm autumn

image.altText: Illustration of two children playing in rain and mud for the first time, happy and jumping.

props.synopsis: Some kids had never seen a puddle until the Millennium Drought broke. The decade-long dry spell sweeping Australia delivered more than cracked earth, it changed our relationship with water.

title.children: The legacy of Australia’s worst drought lives on in our bathrooms

image.altText: a man in a blue formal shirt sitting at a park bench with a body of water behind him

props.synopsis: Riverland resident Mike Fuller is pleased to see government agencies have admitted some faults, particularly in sourcing local knowledge, when managing major River Murray flooding.

title.children: Flooded residents welcome call to be included should another disaster strike

image.altText: A ewe with docked tail, and lamb stand in a dry, dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: Hay prices jumped dramatically in some parts of Australia this week with a supplier saying he had sold more this week than in any of the big droughts in the past 20 years.

title.children: Desperate farmers scramble for hay as drought bites

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: The South Australian premier says an investigation into an 18-year-old man's alleged threats of a "physical attack" at public events and to an Adelaide school was "the most complex" case he has been briefed on.

title.children: Teen called himself 'prophet of justice' in alleged school threats

image.altText: Luke Beveridge scratches his head

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge warns Port Adelaide chair David Koch of retribution over a claim Willie Rioli was sledged by his players.

title.children: Beveridge fires back at claims Bulldogs provoked Power's Rioli

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.

title.children: How an argument ended with the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: Tom Koutsantonis talking in front of leafy a backdrop

props.synopsis: A ban on preferential bookings in a bid to ensure a fairer and more reliable access taxi system will come into effect next week.

title.children: Changes to 'broken' access cab system amid 'corruption' claims

image.altText: An alleged dangerous driver outside the Christies Beach Magistrates Court.

props.synopsis: A driver who rammed a motorcyclist into a pole during a road rage incident in Adelaide's south, leaving her with life-threatening injuries, has been jailed.

title.children: Road rage driver jailed after leaving woman 'lucky to be alive'

image.altText: Luke holds a platter of edible insects next to wine glasses.

props.synopsis: From pet food to human food, insects have many potential uses in Australia. But the industry has to overcome some big challenges around public perception first.

title.children: Insects with your wine? Vineyard's bid to capitalise on growing trend

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: South Australia's work safety agency is examining the circumstances surrounding the collapse of a stone wall that claimed the life of a 46-year-old man on a property in the Barossa region.

title.children: Man killed in stone wall collapse in Barossa Valley

image.altText: A red and white sign reads '2022/23 flood level' with an arrow pointing down to a red line, a dirt levee is behind it

props.synopsis: A damning report reviewing one of South Australia's worst natural disasters in the state's history reflects on how some government agencies could have improved their response.

title.children: SA government agencies 'fell short' in flood response, report finds

image.altText: A group of emergency services personnel stand facing the back of an ambulance with a large white sheet to the left

props.synopsis: The man has been taken to hospital and is in a critical but stable condition.

title.children: Man bitten by shark off SA beach, emergency services say

image.altText: A mechanic with a car.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's election pledge for nuclear reactors caused deep divisions within the community of Port Augusta — now that it's been taken off the agenda, locals are looking towards different futures.

title.children: Nuclear off the table in Port Augusta, as locals look in other directions

image.altText: Repair works on electrical infrastructure.

props.synopsis: Business owners are urged to review their policies after a blackout that took 26,000 properties offline in March. Just one of 70 surveyed traders says their insurance has covered the losses.

title.children: What happens to a small town when the power goes out for 24 hours

image.altText: A young woman holding a drill and sitting on a round table and a middle-aged man standing behind her holding a hammer in a room

props.synopsis: A social media star who purchased her first home during a road trip to outback NSW says renovating it and two other properties with her dad helps her unwind from her busy life.

title.children: TikTok star's outback reno side hustle boosts father-daughter bond

image.altText: House debris piled up on a hill

props.synopsis: An inquiry into a series of landslides on the Mornington Peninsula, just outside Melbourne has heard multiple theories as to what caused them. Several theories involve water damage throughout the hillside neighbourhood.

title.children: The collapse of a multi-million-dollar home shocked many. But clues may have bubbled up for weeks

image.altText: A large cargo ship with Hong Tai 58 emblazoned on its front sits docked at a port.

props.synopsis: Taiwan has accused China of carrying out what it calls "grey zone" warfare, which is designed to pressure the island without direct confrontation and psychologically wear down locals ahead of an invasion.

title.children: Why ships lurking in Taiwan's waters could be a 'prelude to a coming war'

image.altText: People sitting around table and having a meeting

props.synopsis: Ukrainian Defence Minister Rustem Umerov says Kyiv and Moscow will exchange 1,000 captives but a date for the swap will not be made public.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine agree prisoner swap deal in first direct talks for years

image.altText: Sussan Ley and her mother Angela Braybrooks.

props.synopsis: Newly appointed federal Liberal leader Sussan Ley pays tribute to her mother, who died during the early hours of Saturday.

title.children: Liberal leader Sussan Ley's mother dies, days after leadership success

image.altText: A man in a striped polo in a glass cell

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in the Russian-controlled part of eastern Ukraine said the Melbourne teacher had been found guilty of participating in an armed conflict as a mercenary.

title.children: Federal government 'appalled' at Russia's 13-year prison sentence for Oscar Jenkins

image.altText: A photo of grey seashells aligned to spell out 8-6-4-7 on the sand of a beach

props.synopsis: A photo of seashells posted to former FBI director James Comey's Instagram account has sparked controversy in the US, with some saying it is a call for violence against President Donald Trump.

title.children: 'A child knows what he meant': Trump says ex-FBI director's seashell photo is a death threat

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former SAS corporal will likely spend the coming days pouring over the reasons for the dismissal of his appeal.

title.children: 'We're talking millions of dollars': Roberts-Smith facing huge costs bill

image.altText: Donald Trump's face shown close up while he frowns and looks to his right

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump takes aim at US music giants Bruce Springsteen and Taylor Swift in blistering posts on social media.

title.children: Trump calls Springsteen a 'dried out prune', says Taylor Swift 'no longer hot'

image.altText: People eat beef pho at a breakfast restaurant in Hanoi

props.synopsis: Pho is a beloved national dish for Vietnamese across borders and political divisions. Some say that means it has potential to heal the deep wounds of civil war.

title.children: Inside the dish that conquered Vietnam and then the world

image.altText: halle berry cannes

props.synopsis: You know someone's all out of runway for their cause when they start throwing around words like "decency".

title.children: Excusez-moi? Cannes Film Festival's dress code is nakedly hypocritical

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The jury in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial have been given a masterclass on death cap mushrooms, which caused the deaths of three of her relatives and left one seriously ill.

title.children: Jury hears of mushrooms, medicine and mystery in the Erin Patterson trial

image.altText: crisp doran

props.synopsis: The case of a child sex offender who was on the run for three decades has led to revelations of links between paedophiles who worked at a Queensland Catholic school.

title.children: Church reported concerns about school paedophile links

image.altText: Waratahs head coach Dan McKellar during the warm-up, arms folded, looking intently

props.synopsis: NSW Waratahs coach Dan McKellar has promised a "brutal" review of the organisation following its 48-33 loss to the Crusaders on Friday night.

title.children: Waratahs coach promises 'brutal' review of rugby club

image.altText: A giant illuminated animal sculptures

props.synopsis: Star-gazing, nude solstice swims and spectacular light shows are part of a growing travel trend known as "noctourism" that's injecting hundreds of millions of dollars into Australia's economy each year.

title.children: Rise in after-dark travel drives tourism surge across Australia

image.altText: A tv remote in red and white sepia

props.synopsis: Australian media has evolved from nitrate tapes and VHS into a digital age. It could come with new challenges for the world of cultural preservation.

title.children: Streaming promised a 'golden age' of media. Then shows began disappearing
